channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves, 9th November
item.description:
I live on Broomhill Road opposite the common. The leaves have been dropping of the trees for a while now and have caused a large build up on the public footpath potentially causing a slip hazard to people using the public path. I would be very grateful if you could deal with this matter, thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cyril Road, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 9th November
item.description:
This van has been in the same place and not moved for over 8 months now! - I reported it to you nearly 4 months ago and nothing has happened. The van is in a state of disrepair and has quite obviously been dumped or stolen. It is taking up valuable parking spaces that local residents nearby need. It even had to be bumped back by council workers so they could chop down a tree which has a notice on it to remove the vehicle before they carried out their work as it was in the way but obviously it wasn’t moved as it had been dumped? This van has now been stationary for a significant length of time and is in poor condition and you as the local council have a duty to remove abandoned vehicles in the borough

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 191, Blackfen Road, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brown building terrace of shops, 9th November
item.description:
Tbh is building is an absolute eyesore. It is poorly managed, has bad tenants, has missing cladding panels that have had a temporary repair for months (the purple boards) and has graffiti above the two metre level. I realise that only some of the graffiti posted is within the council’s remit. Somebody from Planning needs to take charge of this building please. Also whatever department can force graffiti removal. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Arch Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet
